etymology.description: 乌(烏) (wū, "crow; black") and 鲁(魯) (lǔ, "foolish; clumsy")
etymology.interpretation: 乌鲁(烏魯) (wūlǔ) is a compound word with no direct conceptual correlation with its parts, as it serves as a transliteration. It is often used in names, such as place names like 乌鲁木齐(烏魯木齊) (Wūlǔmùqí), the capital of Xinjiang in China.

examples.chinese: 古老的乌鲁文明令人惊叹(古老的烏魯文明令人驚歎)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔlǎo de wūlǔ wénmíng lìng rén jīngtàn.
examples.english: The ancient Uru civilization is astonishing.

examples.chinese: 游客参观乌鲁遗址(遊客參觀烏魯遺址)，并记录历史(並記錄歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Yóukè cānguān wūlǔ yízhǐ, bìng jìlù lìshǐ.
examples.english: Tourists visit the Uru ruins and record history.
